poem:
### At the Base

Amid the night's restless hum,  
the truck—shadow on asphalt—  
seeks entry where protests  
left echoes ringing.  

In halogen pools, fear  
finds its form—shattering silence  
in crackles of authority,  
a dance of lights,  
red and blue.  

Metal cools against the coast's breath,  
questions curdle in the dawn's fog.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. In a statement, the Coast Guard said that at around 10.00pm local time on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
